problem.markdown:
>>1)What is Craniometry?<< ( ) concerned with the technique of measurement on the cranium ( ) Concerned with the technique of measurement on face of the skeleton. (x) Both a and b ( ) None of above
>>2)How to calculate Cranial index?<< ( ) Min. Cranial Breadth x 100 / Max. Cranial Length ( ) Bregma Height x 100 / Max. Carnial Length (x) Max. Cranial Breadth x 100 / Max. Cranial Length ( ) None of above
>>3) What is Basion-Bregma?<< ( ) The straight distance from the basion to bregma. ( ) Bregma (b) is the meeting point of the sagittal and coronal sutures (x) Both a and b ( ) None of above
>>4) What is Bizygomatic breadth?<< ( ) The straight distance from one zygion to the other. ( ) Zygion is the most lateral point of the zygomatic arch ( ) The straight distance from the nasion to zygion (x) Both a and b
>>5) How to calculate Transverse Vertical Index?<< (x) Basion -Bregma Height x 100 / Max. Cranial Breadth ( ) Bregma Height x 100 / Max. Carnial Length ( ) Upper Facial Height x 100 / Bizygomatic Breadth ( ) None of above
>>6) Which instrument is used to measure Maximum Cranial Breadth?<< (x) Spreading Caliper ( ) Sliding Caliper ( ) Vernier Caliper ( ) Pelvimeter
>>7) What is Opisthocranion ?<< ( ) is the most posterior point from the glabella in the mid-sagittal plane ( ) excluding the inion ( ) is the most prominent point between the two superaorbital (x) both a and b
>>8) What is NASION-INION PLANE ?<< ( ) when the nasion and inion are on the same vertical plane (x) when the nasion and inion are on the same horizontal plane ( ) at a angular distance from inion ( ) on the right of nasion
>>9) What is a porion?<< ( ) distance between upper margin and lower margin of skull ( ) internal auditory meatus (x) the deepest point on the upper margin of the external auditory meatus ( ) ridges above the fronto-nasal suture in the mid-sagittal plane
>>10) What is Maximum Cranial Breadth?<< (x) Straight distance between the two euryon points ( ) Angular distance between the two euryon points. ( ) The straight distance from the glabella ( ) Distance between glabella and euryon

choicegroup.label: 1)What is Craniometry?
choicegroup.choice: concerned with the technique of measurement on the cranium
Concerned with the technique of measurement on face of the skeleton.
Both a and b
None of above

choicegroup.label: 2)How to calculate Cranial index?
choicegroup.choice: Min. Cranial Breadth x 100 / Max. Cranial Length
Bregma Height x 100 / Max. Carnial Length
Max. Cranial Breadth x 100 / Max. Cranial Length
None of above

choicegroup.label: 3) What is Basion-Bregma?
choicegroup.choice: The straight distance from the basion to bregma.
Bregma (b) is the meeting point of the sagittal and coronal sutures
Both a and b
None of above

choicegroup.label: 4) What is Bizygomatic breadth?
choicegroup.choice: The straight distance from one zygion to the other.
Zygion is the most lateral point of the zygomatic arch
The straight distance from the nasion to zygion
Both a and b

problem.p: 5) How to calculate Transverse Vertical Index?

choicegroup.label: 5) How to calculate Transverse Vertical Index?
choicegroup.choice: Basion -Bregma Height x 100 / Max. Cranial Breadth
Bregma Height x 100 / Max. Carnial Length
Upper Facial Height x 100 / Bizygomatic Breadth
None of above

problem.p: 6) Which instrument is used to measure Maximum Cranial Breadth?

choicegroup.label: 6) Which instrument is used to measure Maximum Cranial Breadth?
choicegroup.choice: Spreading Caliper
Sliding Caliper
Vernier Caliper
Pelvimeter

choicegroup.label: 7) What is Opisthocranion ?
choicegroup.choice: is the most posterior point from the glabella in the mid-sagittal plane
excluding the inion
is the most prominent point between the two superaorbital
both a and b

choicegroup.label: 8) What is NASION-INION PLANE ?
choicegroup.choice: when the nasion and inion are on the same vertical plane
when the nasion and inion are on the same horizontal plane
at a angular distance from inion
on the right of nasion

choicegroup.label: 9) What is a porion?
choicegroup.choice: distance between upper margin and lower margin of skull
internal auditory meatus
the deepest point on the upper margin of the external auditory meatus
ridges above the fronto-nasal suture in the mid-sagittal plane

choicegroup.label: 10) What is Maximum Cranial Breadth?
choicegroup.choice: Straight distance between the two euryon points
Angular distance between the two euryon points.
The straight distance from the glabella
Distance between glabella and euryon
